definition: to give a favor (used of Christian God)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
favor/grace/kindness
variant of 恩[en1]

sentences.english: Remove from me the way of lying: and grant me thy law graciously.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我离开奸诈的道，开恩将你的律法赐给我。

sentences.english: Keep me from deceitful ways; be gracious to me through your law.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我离开奸诈的道，开恩将你的律法赐给我。

sentences.english: Roundtrip Economy class air ticket for Hong Kong and Cairns on QF.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲航空公司来回香港至开恩斯经济客位机票。

sentences.english: 42Neither of them had the money to pay him back, so he canceled the debts of both.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们无力偿还，债主就开恩免了他们两个人的债。

sentences.english: Hath God forgotten to be gracious?

definition: approved by His (or Her) Majesty/permission graciously granted (from highly authoritative position)/to graciously permit/to condescend to allow
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to be generous (idiom)/to be magnanimous/Give me a break!
mortal crime/capital offense
to pardon/to forgive
please forgive me
to spare sb's life
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to apologize humbly/to beg forgiveness
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to confess one's fault/to accept one's punishment
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
the grass roots/the hoi polloi
to punish
to atone for one's crimes by meritorious acts
